context:
Rearrange the code blocks to create a Class Object ``"Dog"``. A Dog have multiple attributes: name, breed and owner.


Misconception:
    - InitReturnObject: __init__ must return an object.

choices.content:
self.name = name
self.owner = owner
self.breed = breed

choices.fail_msg: If you return a Dog inside the Dog's init function, it will keep trying to create new Dogs forever, causing the program to get stuck in an endless loop.
You don´t need to return self when creating an object.
